meanings.definition: a type of traditional African clothing
meanings.sent1: She wore a colorful djibba to the cultural festival.
meanings.sent2: The djibba was made of soft, woven fabric.
meanings.sent3: His djibba was so bright, it could be seen from far away.
meanings.sent4: The djibba wrapped around her like a warm hug.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the djibba told a story of ancient traditions.

meanings.sent1: The children began to djibba joyfully at the party.
meanings.sent2: Everyone joined in to djibba when the music started playing.
meanings.sent3: He tried to djibba quietly in his room without waking anyone up.
meanings.sent4: The dancers seemed to djibba in perfect harmony with the beat.
meanings.sent5: She couldn't help but djibba with a big smile on her face.

meanings.definition: relating to the culture or style of the Djibba people
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed beautiful djibba artifacts from the ancient tribe.
meanings.sent2: Her djibba jewelry was passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The djibba music filled the room with a sense of tradition.
meanings.sent4: The art exhibit showcased stunning djibba paintings.
meanings.sent5: The festival celebrated all things djibba, from food to dance.
